topic.title: Forward reports
topic.p: This chapter explains how to configure the following products for forwarding Qodana reports to Qodana Cloud:

chapter.title: Docker
chapter.p: This is the CLI command to inspect your code and forward the report to Qodana Cloud using the Dockerized version of Qodana:
In this snippet, the QODANA_TOKEN environment variable specifies the project token of Qodana Cloud.

chapter.title: GitHub Actions
chapter.p: To start receiving Qodana reports using GitHub Actions, create an encrypted secret with the QODANA_TOKEN name.
Add this snippet to the workflow:
chapter.code: - name: 'Qodana Scan' uses: JetBrains/qodana-action@main env: QODANA_TOKEN: ${{ secrets.QODANA_TOKEN }}
chapter.p: To learn more, see the GitHub Actions section of the Qodana documentation portal.

chapter.title: GitLab CI/CD
chapter.p: To forward Qodana reports using GitLab CI/CD, define the QODANA_TOKEN variable in your repository.
Add this snippet to your CI/CD pipeline:
chapter.code: qodana: image: name: jetbrains/qodana-<linter> entrypoint: [''] script: - qodana --results-dir=$CI_PROJECT_DIR/qodana --save-report --report-dir=$CI_PROJECT_DIR/qodana/report artifacts: paths: - qodana

chapter.title: TeamCity
chapter.p: To configure TeamCity to forward Qodana reports to Qodana Cloud, follow these steps:

procedure.step: Create the QODANA_TOKEN environment variable and define it as password.

step.p: Specify -e QODANA_TOKEN=%env.QODANA_TOKEN% in the Additional arguments for 'docker run' field.

chapter.p: If necessary, repeat this configuration. For example, besides code inspection you may want to configure Clone Finder or License audit features on the same runner.
